pr_title: Add support for converting avro schemas containing timestamps without the adjust-to-utc annotations

timeline.message:
Add support for converting avro schemas containing timestamps without the adjust-to-utc property

Default avro timestamps to the timestamp iceberg type to follow avro timestamp semantics

timeline.bodyText: How about "default to timestamp" or "default to timestamp without time zone"?
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: This is the same behavior as before because null would not pass either instanceof check. Do we need to update this other than to add instanceof TimestampMillis above?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
WRT adding instanceof TimestampMillis that was an unrelated bug it seems.
There were two places a similar check was done AvroSchemaUtil.isTimestamptz (used by datareader/datawriters) and SchemaToType.primitive but the two places were not consistent. I am just making those two checks both use the same utility function.
replies.author: grantatspothero

replies.bodyText:
You are totally right this instanceof change is not strictly necessary, just makes it more explicit.
The bit that is important is the change in this file which before failed: core/src/main/java/org/apache/iceberg/avro/SchemaToType.java
replies.author: grantatspothero
